articles.author: Sascha Pare
articles.title: Hammer-headed bat: The African megabat that looks like a gargoyle and holds honking pageants - Livescience.com
articles.description: Hammer-headed bats are named after the males' oversized boxy heads, which evolved to amplify and project the honking sounds they produce to impress females during courtship displays.
articles.content:
Name: Hammer-headed bat (Hypsignathus monstrosus)
Where it lives: Lowland forests of West and Central Africa
What it eats: Fruit — including figs, bananas, guavas and mangoes — and flies
